title: Introducing smite into the support role

embed.description: Marks I take armor marks because Thresh early on is very squishy and can be easily shot down by the carry. With the marks it will help you survive longer and soak up more damage. Seals Seals have the same reason as the marks. Thresh is very dependent on his runes early game.

body: Check out the guide. I'm still testing it. I want more people to test this as well. I believe smite on supports in season 5 can be very beneficial. Please try this method and post suggestions, feedback, and even footage of your game play. Thank you!

Bring both.
And give up Flash...?

Yes give up flash. I know it is the most useful, versatile summoner spell, but you are a tanky support, not a carry. You don't need it as much to get away, because you should be baiting the enemy team to save your carry. And it isn't as useful as it once was to get away anyway, what with the obsession with champions whose mobility has no limit. Udyr, Zed, Lee Sin, and other champs can follow you over walls easy, without using their flash at all. (Udyr just runs around the wall fast enough to catch you) Therefore, it is a viable option to run spells which enhance your ability to fight these champions, and prevent the situations where Flash would be needed.

Take my Heimerdinger game for instance. I always run Barrier+Heal, which allows me to be more secure in my turret ranges, even at low health. When someone tries to engage, I can instantly have a health pool twice as large as before. 

With Janna, I take Teleport+Heal, which gives me a quick back, allowing for more daring pokes, with less wasted time. I can also still heal my carry, which, in addition to my shield, usually turns the tide of a fight. Then, late game, I am fast enough to run away from any fight where I am not surrounded.

These are just a few examples of times Flash not only isn't necessary, but actually preferred to NOT take.

Yeah. An absolutely insane idea, isn't it? No Flash? What, I mean, how could you even think to win without it?

Yes, give up Flash. I'm sick of seeing it, if nothing else, and it isn't a necessary spell. Not anywhere close to below Diamond, and not when its cooldown is five freaking minutes.

I find that each has its own benefits depending on the enemies team comp your comp and playstyles personally I always take ignite because its become normal for a adc to take heal vs barrier ignite cuts heals effectiveness in half and deals a good bit off dmg on top of that and it lasts twice as long as exhaust (if I remember correctly) ignite is 4 seconds where as exhaust is only 2 but again the dmg/ms/as/resistances reduction is very useful and it depends on the type of supp you're playing, I play a lot of "carry" supps like Brand or Xerath and I normally play/build them as if I were still in mid lane xD

If you ever grab smite instead of exhaust as Thresh, you don't know what you're doing. The fact that you have to build a jungling item just to get the slow on smite is in itself enough to make it stupid on supports.
Not only for the slow, did you see what Juggernaut gives??

Which is great for a tank, but tell me how that's better than, say, buiding merc treads and any other health item? Say, Spirit Visage.

In the end, if you're not going to jungle, any investment into a hunter's machete and upgrading it is a net loss and the upgrade to smite is not worth it. The upgrade to smite is only there to make the spell useful outside of the jungle for junglers. In all situations, exhaust is a better pick than smite if you're not going to jungle.

I can answer that

Merc Treads-provide nothing for the team benefit. Big benefits of it is just Tenacity for support, ergo useless.

Spirit Visage-Provides nothing for a team benefit. Big benefits of the item is MR and HP for support, ergo useless.

Juggernaut-Provides a 50% slow every 60 second, as a jungler, this has been my go to item on literally every single jungler, regardless of the recommended knife for that champion, I can not stress how many kills it has managed to secure for me, its incredibly powerful, the team utility on it is insane. To have it on a support, that would be rather scary since the threat is ever constant.  Not only that, it never falls off, 50% slow is still deadly even as it hits late game. 

Not only that Juggernaut provides 2 of the three things your item provides, it also brings a huge addition to team fight, laning, and cleaning up. It also only occupies one item slot as oppose to your two. 

I'll say it again, running smite/slow will be an incredibly niche pick, but it most definitely can work when the need for it rises. If you're starting Gromp side, you get a HUGE advantage over the opposing lane with the poison damage harass, in addition to the slow effect of smite. 

As it stands, exhaust is largely useless again AD caster since their damage comes in burst before you can get the exhaust down on them. Looking at some of the more popular champions in the preseason, AD casters have been getting incredibly more popular, Lucian, Graves, and Corki seem to be the trinity of ADC at the current moment, with Ezreal being another popular pick, of those four, three have damage tied into burst of which, you need to have incredibly fast reaction to negate their burst with exhaust.

Don't believe me? Look at some of the current Challenger/Plat/Masters games that have been played, you'll noticed many supports are running ignite again over exhaust now, specifically because of the reason I mentioned above.

Ignite falls off hard, smite does not.

I would also like to remind to get the slow attachment, it only costs around 700 gold, hardly inefficient in the slightest. You can just merely buy the base component, then upgrade it to juggernaut in the later game, the same way supports do that with sightstones.
